question_text: A 73-year-old woman is evaluated for a 3-week history of proximal muscle weakness.Skin findings are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Typical cutaneous involvement of dermatomyositis (Option A) is the Gottron rash (Gottron papules and Gottron sign), consisting of erythematous to violaceous, slightly scaly papules and plaques over the metacarpophalangeal and proximal interphalangeal joints, as seen in this patient. These findings also may be found overlying the elbows, knees, or feet. This type of cutaneous involvement is pathognomonic of dermatomyositis.
